sentence.text: The risks involved in displeasing the company were deemed to be too great .
There 's a caravan leaving for Kinsai in the morning , and anyone who displeases me will be on it . "

Hodgkiss 's manner displeased Frederica ; he had a mannered Oxford voice , elided words , and used the pronoun " one " frequently .

The compliment slightly displeased him .
Newspapers are closed and journalists are sent to jail if they displease our foreign masters . "

No doubt she could see the danger signs when things displeased her powerful son .

Although she backed the plan to ‘ keep Hong Kong prosperous ’ until 1997 in the Commons yesterday , she let the Cabinet know she was displeased by the row .

Then if the wife displeases him he can distract himself with her little slave . "
